Michael Cohen: s testimony before the U.S. House of Representatives Committee on Oversight and Reform, where he admitted to tax fraud and campaign-finance violations relating to his payment of "hush money" to women who alleged they had sexual relationships with Donald Trump before he became president.
Cohen: s admission of previously misleading Congress about the proposed deal to build a Trump Tower in Moscow, Russia, which continued negotiations until June 2016.
Observers: including President Trump, attempting to portray Cohen as an agent of Hillary Clinton, suggesting that she was paying Cohen to provide damning testimony against Trump.
The absence of evidence that Cohen: s attorney, Lanny Davis, has ever acted as Clinton's personal attorney, although Davis has longstanding ties to the Clintons and was a special counsel to former President Bill Clinton.
